page.title: 05EDUCATION IN THE AREA
page.content: The older schools in the area were church schools. Later the W.R.C.C built several schools. After 1944 the education was in Infant, Junior, Sec- ondary Modern and Grammar Schools. In 1972 reorganisation took place and 9 First (5-9), 3 Middle (9-13) and 1 Comprehensive School (13-18) were established. Following a decrease in the birth rate in the 1970s 2 First Schools were closed.Today all First and Middle Schools have smaller rolls and one wonders if with the continuing drop in numbers and some parents wishing older children to go to Sixth Form Colleges whether further closures or reorganisation could be imminent. People in the area attend F.E. classes at Mirfield,Dewsbury & Batley Technical & Art College & Huddersfield Technical College & Polytechnic.
